p: The use of formic acid based preservative (FAB) in a research carried out by Filya et al [ 29], increased the degradability of DM and OM of corn silages. The antimicrobial property of FAB prevented the development of enterobacteria and clostridia spores, particularly yeast and mould, and this caused DM and OM degradability of silages to increase. Cumin essential oil used in this research revealed a similar effect with formic acid, thus increased the amount of OM dissolved in the enzyme significantly in comparison with the CON group (p<0.05).
